title: Loopback
historical_context: This article marks the revival of the Loopback tradition in Phrack, which had been absent for years. It reflects the changing dynamics of the underground hacking community and the Phrack publication itself.
target_audience: Hackers, security enthusiasts, and followers of hacker culture.
short_summary: The Loopback section returns to Phrack, inviting readers to engage with the staff and share their thoughts. It reflects on the evolution of community interactions and the importance of feedback in the underground scene.
summary: The Phrack staff announces the return of the Loopback section, a platform for reader responses and community engagement that had been absent for some time. The staff humorously acknowledges their previous elitism and invites contributions from the underground community. They express a desire to reconnect with their audience and encourage open dialogue, emphasizing the fun and collaborative spirit of the hacking culture. The article serves as a reminder of the importance of community feedback and the evolution of interactions within the hacker scene over the years. It highlights the shift from a more dismissive attitude towards reader contributions to a more inclusive approach, aiming to foster a sense of belonging among readers and contributors alike.
